content: Restaurant in Portland, Oregon, U.S. **Friendship Kitchen** is a restaurant with two locations in [Portland, Oregon](/wiki/Portland,_Oregon), United States. The original restaurant opened in 2021, serving [Vietnamese cuisine](/wiki/Vietnamese_cuisine). The outpost **Friendship Kitchen NW: From Saigon 2 Singapore** opened in 2023 and serves [Singaporean cuisine](/wiki/Singaporean_cuisine) in addition to Vietnamese food. ## Description The [Asian Pacific American](/wiki/Asian_Pacific_Americans)- and [LGBTQ-owned](/wiki/LGBTQ-owned_business) restaurant Friendship Kitchen operates in [Portland, Oregon](/wiki/Portland,_Oregon). The original restaurant on Glisan Street in the [northeast Portland](/wiki/Northeast_Portland,_Oregon) part of the [Kerns](/wiki/Kerns,_Portland,_Oregon) neighborhood serves [Vietnamese cuisine](/wiki/Vietnamese_cuisine). The restaurant has a patio and the interior has [neon signs](/wiki/Neon_sign) and patterned lanterns. The menu includes [bánh mì](/wiki/B%C3%A1nh_m%C3%AC), *[bún bò Huế](/wiki/B%C3%BAn_b%C3%B2_Hu%E1%BA%BF)*, noodle dishes, [pho](/wiki/Pho), and cocktails. The curry dish cà ri is called Keep Calm and Cà Ri On. On the drink menu, the Fresh Off the Boat has ginger-infused gin and the White Men Tears has rum and [coconut milk](/wiki/Coconut_milk). The Pho-Jito has rum, Combier, cilantro, and a syrup made with [cardamom](/wiki/Cardamom), cinnamon, and star anise. The Thai'd Up is an alcoholic and iced [Thai tea](/wiki/Thai_tea). Other drinks use [lychee](/wiki/Lychee), mango, [tamarind](/wiki/Tamarind), vodka, and whiskey. Friendship Kitchen NW: From Saigon 2 Singapore operates on Thurman Street in [northwest Portland](/wiki/Northwest_Portland,_Oregon)'s [Northwest District](/wiki/Northwest_District,_Portland,_Oregon). In addition to Vietnamese food, the outpost serves [Singaporean cuisine](/wiki/Singaporean_cuisine) such as [bánh xèo](/wiki/B%C3%A1nh_x%C3%A8o), [Hainanese chicken rice](/wiki/Hainanese_chicken_rice), and [laksa](/wiki/Laksa). The outpost also serves [ragout](/wiki/Ragout) with [braised](/wiki/Braising) chicken in tomato-red wine sauce, as well as garlic butter shrimp and [steak frites](/wiki/Steak_frites), soy-sugarcane drumsticks with vegan fish sauce, and garden rolls with tofu skin. In addition to pho, both locations have served *[bánh tét](/wiki/B%C3%A1nh_t%C3%A9t)* around the holiday [Tết](/wiki/T%E1%BA%BFt). ## History Trang Nguyen opened the original restaurant in northeast Portland in 2021, later than a previously announced opening date of November 2020. The outpost Friendship Kitchen NW: From Saigon 2 Singapore opened in October 2023. Since Nguyen married Wei-En Tan and became known as Trang Nguyen Tan, the couple have been credited for operating both establishments. Stem Wine Bar has been described as a "sister" business to Friendship Kitchen. ## Reception In 2024, Nick Woo, Krista Garcia, and Janey Wong included Friendship Kitchen in *[Eater Portland](/wiki/Eater_(website))*'s overview of Portland's best Vietnamese restaurants, and Waz Wu included Friendship Kitchen NW in the website's overview of the city's "most comforting" vegan noodle soups. Friendship Kitchen placed second in the Best Vietnamese Restaurant category of *[Willamette Week](/wiki/Willamette_Week)*'s annual Best of Portland readers' poll in 2024. - Food portal - Oregon portal - [LGBTQ culture in Portland, Oregon](/wiki/LGBTQ_culture_in_Portland,_Oregon) - [List of restaurant chains in the United States](/wiki/List_of_restaurant_chains_in_the_United_States) - [List of Vietnamese restaurants](/wiki/List_of_Vietnamese_restaurants) - Official website (Friendship Kitchen) - Official website (Friendship Kitchen NW: From Saigon 2 Singapore)
